intro: Commelina elata, commonly known as the slender spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae, which includes many species of grass-like plants. The plant features slender, erect stems with lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its showy, blue or purple flowers are borne in clusters and are surrounded by three bracts. Commelina elata is often found in moist, disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
